subject: Technology
title: Screen Time: How Much Is Too Much?
description: A quick win: understand Screen Time: How Much Is Too Much?.

hook.text: The average adult spends over 7 hours a day on screens. That's more time than they spend sleeping.

buildup.text: Between phones, computers, TVs, and tablets, screens dominate waking hours. For teens, social media alone averages 3 hours daily.

discovery.text: Research links excessive screen time to poor sleep, reduced attention spans, and increased anxiety, especially in adolescents.

twist.text: Silicon Valley executives famously limit their own children's screen time. They know the product's effects better than anyone.

climax.text: The question isn't whether screens are bad. It's whether we choose how we use them, or let algorithms choose for us.

punchline.text: The people who build these tools don't let their kids use them freely.

quiz.question: Why is it significant that tech executives limit their children's screen time?
options: They can't afford devices for their kids
They understand the addictive design of their own products
